entry.title: New target may help protect bones as we age
entry.summary: Drugs we take like prednisone can weaken our bones and so can aging, and scientists working to prevent both have some of the first evidence that the best target may not be the logical one. They are finding that in aging bone, the mineralocorticoid receptor, better known for its role in blood pressure regulation, is a key factor in bone health.

entry.title: New target may help protect bones as we age
entry.summary: Drugs we take like prednisone can weaken our bones and so can aging, and scientists working to prevent both have some of the first evidence that the best target may not be the logical one. They are finding that in aging bone, the mineralocorticoid receptor, better known for its role in blood pressure regulation, is a key factor in bone health.

entry.title: Azure Container Apps Dapr Binding Example
entry.summary:
We are happy to introduce this Preview feature which enables you to run microservices and containerized applications on a serverless platform.
Considering the distributed nature of microservices, you need to account for failures, retries, and timeouts in a system composed of microservices. While Container Apps features the building blocks for running microservices, use of Dapr (Distributed Application Runtime) provides an even richer microservices programming model.
Azure Container Apps offers a fully managed version of the Dapr APIs when building microservices. When you use Dapr in Azure Container Apps, you can enable sidecars to run next to your microservices that provide a rich set of capabilities. Available Dapr APIs include Service to Service calls, Pub/Sub, Event Bindings, State …

entry.title: GitHub Actions: Changing the search order for self-hosted runners
entry.summary: GitHub Actions: Changing the search order for self-hosted runners

entry.title: Choline during pregnancy impacts children’s sustained attention
entry.summary: Seven-year-old children performed better on a challenging task requiring sustained attention if their mothers consumed twice the recommended amount of choline during their pregnancy, a new study has found.

entry.title: Annual Review 2021
entry.summary: Introduction 2021 was the year of commitment. I committed to my writing, committed to my business, committed to my existing social circle, committed to my longtime hobbies, and committed to my new hometown of Austin, Texas. This posture of commitment stands in contrast to the first five years of my career, which were defined by The post Annual Review 2021 appeared first on David Perell.

entry.title: COVID-19 patients have severely increased levels of oxidative stress and oxidant damage, and glutathione deficiency, study finds
entry.summary: Patients hospitalized with COVID-19 had significantly increased levels of oxidative stress and oxidant damage, and markedly reduced levels of glutathione, the most abundant physiological antioxidant, according to a new study.

entry.title: Neuroprotective mechanism altered by Alzheimer's disease risk genes
entry.summary: Researchers have discovered that gene variants associated with risk of developing Alzheimer's disease disturb the brain's natural protective mechanism against the condition.

entry.title: Recently
entry.summary:
I wrote a little yearly round-up over on Placemark. I’m not one for concrete resolutions or nostalgia, so on with the usual, a Recently. Reading I read Policing the Open Road on Rebecca’s suggestion. It’s an incredible book that I’ll probably re-read soon, because the central conflict that it sets out feels so thoroughly deadlocked, unresolvable, and important - the interplay between privacy, safety, police power, and freedom. I don’t agree with all of it, but Jon McLoone’s explanatio of why Wolfram is not open source resonated strongly with me. Placemark, as I’ve said before, is not planning on being open source, though components of the application will be released. Some of my reasoning lines up with Wolfram’s pretty precisely. The central piece for me, I think, is just what the community means - where communities come from, how they agree on what they do, how they collect and disperse. Magical thinking around what constitutes community and how it operates is my biggest gripe about open source ideology in this day and age: too many people happily ignore the top-heaviness of some communities, or don’t think about where the direction, leadership, contributions, and standards come from. Watching
Watch Vampire’s Kiss. That is all. Expect to see in the new year: more, probably shorter, blog posts. More photos. And Placemark, out in the wild.

entry.title: COVID-19 can trigger self-attacking antibodies
entry.summary: Infection with the virus that causes COVID-19 can trigger an immune response that lasts well beyond the initial infection and recovery -- even among people who had mild symptoms or no symptoms at all, according to investigators.

entry.title: Leveraging space to advance stem cell science and medicine
entry.summary: The secret to producing large batches of stem cells more efficiently may lie in the near-zero gravity conditions of space. Scientists have found that microgravity has the potential to contribute to life-saving advances on Earth by facilitating the rapid mass production of stem cells.

entry.title: Healthy diet in early pregnancy reduces risk of gestational diabetes
entry.summary: A healthy, comprehensive diet that lowers the body's inflammation reduces the risk of gestational diabetes mellitus, reveals a new study.

entry.title: Microglial methylation 'landscape' in human brain
entry.summary: Recent studies have shown variation in the gene-expression profile and phenotype of microglia across brain regions and between different age and disease states. But the molecular mechanisms that contribute to these transcriptomic changes in the human brain are not well understood. Now, a new study targets the methylation profile of microglia from human brain.

entry.title: Is energy the key to Alzheimer’s disease?
entry.summary: A team of researchers has found a link between the way that cells produce energy for brain function and the mutated genes found in Alzheimer's disease.

entry.title: libxml2>=2.9.12-6 update may require manual intervention
entry.summary:
The libxml2 package prior to version 2.9.12-6 was missing the compiled python modules. This has been fixed in 2.9.12-6, so the upgrade may need to overwrite any untracked pyc files created. If you get errors like these libxml2: /usr/lib/python3.10/site-packages/__pycache__/drv_libxml2.cpython-310.opt-1.pyc exists in filesystem libxml2: /usr/lib/python3.10/site-packages/__pycache__/drv_libxml2.cpython-310.pyc exists in filesystem libxml2: /usr/lib/python3.10/site-packages/__pycache__/libxml2.cpython-310.opt-1.pyc exists in filesystem libxml2: /usr/lib/python3.10/site-packages/__pycache__/libxml2.cpython-310.pyc exists in filesystem
when updating, use pacman -Syu --overwrite /usr/lib/python3.10/site-packages/__pycache__/\*
to perform the upgrade.

entry.title: Disarming a blood-clotting protein prevents gum disease in mice
entry.summary: Blocking function of a blood-clotting protein, called fibrin, prevented bone loss from periodontal (gum) disease in mice, according to new research. The study suggests that suppressing abnormal fibrin activity could hold promise for preventing or treating periodontal disease, as well as other inflammatory disorders marked by fibrin buildup, including arthritis and multiple sclerosis.

entry.title: Dietary fiber improves outcomes for melanoma patients on immunotherapy
entry.summary: Melanoma patients receiving therapy that makes it easier for their immune system to kill cancer cells respond to treatment better when their diet is rich in fiber, according to a large, international research collaboration.

entry.title: Cochlear implant in deaf children with autism can improve language skills and social engagement, study finds
entry.summary: Restoring hearing through cochlear implantation for children with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) can help them understand spoken language and enhance social interactions, according to a new study.

entry.title: Azure Cloud Shell with Oh My Zsh and Oh My Posh
entry.summary:
You likely heard of or currently use oh-my-zsh for your terminal on Linux or Mac, or WSL on Windows. It might also be possible to have heard of or currently use oh-my-posh for your PowerShell. Azure offers Azure Cloud Shell service, which uses both Bash Shell and PowerShell by default. Therefore, if you want either oh-my-zsh or oh-my-posh, or both, you should configure it by yourself.
Throughout this post, I'm going to show how to configure your shell environment for both.
This GitHub repository provides the working shell script source for your reference.
For oh-my-zsh
Let's configure oh-my-zsh on your Azure Cloud Shell. Make sure that you see the Bash Shell prompt. If not, enter the bash command to switch your prompt to Bash.
Install oh-my-zsh. sh -c "$(curl -fsSL \ http…

entry.title: Study confirms nutrient’s role in childhood blood cancer
entry.summary: A molecular building block of many animal proteins, the amino acid valine, plays a key role in cancerous growth seen in T cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia, a new study shows.

entry.title: For some Greenlanders, eating sugar is healthy
entry.summary: A genetic variation among some Greenlanders makes sugar healthy -- significantly more than for most people. According to a new study, gut bacteria and a unique diet that has nourished Greenlanders for millennia have provided them with a genetic variation that offers an incredible advantage.

entry.title: Reduce frailty to lower dementia
entry.summary: Reducing frailty in older adults could be an effective strategy to prevent dementia, according to a largescale new study.

entry.title: Specify who can force push to a repository
entry.summary: Specify who can force push to a repository

entry.title: People with high-risk prediabetes benefit from intensive lifestyle intervention
entry.summary: Intensive lifestyle intervention with plenty of exercise helps people with prediabetes improve their blood glucose levels over a period of years and thus delay or even prevent type 2 diabetes. In particular, individuals with prediabetes at highest risk benefited from intensive lifestyle intervention.

entry.title: How regular exercise can protect against fatty liver associated diseases
entry.summary: Exercise not only trains the muscles but can also prevent the development of fatty liver. A new study shows which molecular adaptations, in particular of the liver mitochondria, can be observed in this process.

entry.title: Small measures can be a big help for children of mothers with depression
entry.summary: Several new studies among Syrian refugee families in Turkey and families with infants in Sweden and Bhutan show that children of mothers in poor mental health risk falling behind in their cognitive development. However, very small changes can suffice to break this correlation and enable the children to return to their normal developmental level. Having plenty of people around them and an available community are two of the most important factors for helping children, in all three countries.

entry.title: Small measures can be a big help for children of mothers with depression
entry.summary: Several new studies among Syrian refugee families in Turkey and families with infants in Sweden and Bhutan show that children of mothers in poor mental health risk falling behind in their cognitive development. However, very small changes can suffice to break this correlation and enable the children to return to their normal developmental level. Having plenty of people around them and an available community are two of the most important factors for helping children, in all three countries.

entry.title: Wear and tear in vulnerable brain areas lead to lesions linked to cognitive decline
entry.summary: As our brains age, small lesions begin to pop up in the bundles of white matter that carry messages between our neurons. The lesions can damage this white matter and lead to cognitive deficits. Now, researchers not only provide an explanation for the location of these lesions but also how they develop in the first place.

entry.title: Hugging the X-Axis
entry.summary: I’ve always struggled with commitment. In a world as grand as ours, shouldn’t we try to experience it all? Change it up. Visit every country. Try a bunch of careers. The menu of life is vast, and it’d be a shame to only order a single entrée. When I say I was allergic to restraint, The post Hugging the X-Axis appeared first on David Perell.

entry.title: GitHub Actions: Improvements to GitHub Actions starter experience
entry.summary: GitHub Actions: Improvements to GitHub Actions starter experience

entry.title: Keeping active through varied activities can reduce risk of developing dementia
entry.summary: Older adults who participate in a variety of different activities are able to reduce their risk of developing dementia, according to a new study.

entry.title: Greater exposure to nitrogen dioxide linked to higher levels of biomarkers of Alzheimer's disease in the brain
entry.summary: A study has found an association between air pollution and higher levels of deposition of beta-amyloid protein in the brain and of neurofilament light (NfL) in cerebrospinal fluid.

entry.title: Women who practice self-compassion are at lower risk of cardiovascular disease
entry.summary: Middle-aged women who practiced self-compassion had lower risk of developing cardiovascular disease, irrespective of their blood pressure, insulin resistance and cholesterol levels.

entry.title: Artificial intelligence accurately predicts who will develop dementia in two years
entry.summary: Artificial intelligence can predict which people who attend memory clinics will develop dementia within two years with 92 per cent accuracy, a largescale new study has concluded. Using data from more than 15,300 patients in the US, researchers found that a form of artificial intelligence called machine learning can accurately tell who will go on to develop dementia.

entry.title: GitHub Pages: using GitHub Actions for builds and deployments for public repositories
entry.summary: GitHub Pages: using GitHub Actions for builds and deployments for public repositories

entry.title: Advisory Database now includes an Unreviewed Advisories section
entry.summary: Advisory Database now includes an Unreviewed Advisories section

entry.summary: Restrict renaming protected branches to admins

entry.title: OpenAPI Description of REST API is now 3.1 compliant
entry.summary: OpenAPI Description of REST API is now 3.1 compliant

entry.title: The new GitHub Issues – 12/16 update
entry.summary: The new GitHub Issues - 12/16 update

entry.title: ‘View on GitHub’ link no longer hidden behind email footers
entry.summary: 'View on GitHub' link no longer hidden behind email footers

entry.title: For IBS, specific diets are less important than expected
entry.summary: Many IBS sufferers avoid certain types of food and often exclude gluten. However, a large new study does not show a relationship between high intake of gluten and increased IBS symptoms. The researchers did find that a certain type of carbohydrate called 'fodmaps' can aggravate intestinal problems, however, the overall results indicate that they also have less influence than previously thought.

entry.title: How diet influences taste sensitivity and preference
entry.summary: What you eat influences your taste for what you might want to eat next. So claims a University of California, Riverside, study performed on fruit flies. The study offers a better understanding of neurophysiological plasticity of the taste system in flies.

entry.title: Mindfulness can get wandering thoughts back on track
entry.summary: Mindfulness -- the ability to intentionally focus attention on the present moment -- can be effective for reducing mind wandering, though results do differ depending on the research methodology.

entry.title: Codespaces are now available to an organization’s outside collaborators
entry.summary: Codespaces are now available to an organization's outside collaborators

entry.title: Uncovered: Key to how exercise protects against consequences of aging
entry.summary: Scientists have discovered an enzyme that is key to why exercise improves our health. The discovery opens up the possibility of drugs to promote this enzyme's activity, protecting against the consequences of aging on metabolic health.

entry.title: 'Drink your peas!' Benefits of supplementing cow milk with plant protein
entry.summary: Scientists have developed a novel method of supplementing cow milk with vegetable protein using readily available current dairy processing equipment. A new report presents the study, which may open opportunities to create new functional, multisourced dairy products that could help bolster declining fluid milk sales in the United States.

entry.title: Automated key rotation in Azure Key Vault is now in public preview
entry.summary: Automated key rotation in Key Vault allows security officers to improve data security.

entry.title: Gallic acid and stretching decrease osteoarthritis markers in cartilage cells
entry.summary: Researchers used gallic acid, an antioxidant found in gallnuts, green tea and other plants, and applied a stretching mechanism to human cartilage cells taken from arthritic knees that mimics the stretching that occurs when walking. The combination not only decreased arthritis inflammation markers in the cells but improved the production of desired proteins normally found in healthy cartilage. While still at an early stage, the findings suggest a new procedure could be developed to treat cartilage cells extracted from a patient to grow a supply of cells or a tissue to be re-implanted.

entry.title: Overactive bladder and urinary incontinence worsen with age
entry.summary: If you're feeling more sudden urges to run to the bathroom as you age, you're not alone. A new study suggests postmenopausal women aged 45 to 54 years are more likely to have overactive bladder (OAB) syndrome. Additionally, obesity and multiple births put a woman at greater risk for stress urinary incontinence (SUI).

entry.title: Overweight children are developing heart complications
entry.summary: The percentage of obese children and teens jumped from 19% pre-pandemic to 22%, and that could spell bad news for children's cardiovascular systems both now and down the line.

entry.title: GitHub Desktop now shows pull request check run statuses
entry.summary: GitHub Desktop now shows pull request check run statuses

entry.title: Secret scanning permissions can now be configured as part of custom repository roles
entry.summary: Secret scanning permissions can now be configured as part of custom repository roles

entry.title: Common sleep disorder combo could be deadly
entry.summary: People who suffer from both insomnia and obstructive sleep apnea are more likely to suffer from heart problems and are almost 50% more likely to die than those without either condition, say researchers, who advise people being tested for one of the disorders be tested for the other.

entry.title: Common sleep disorder combo could be deadly
entry.summary: People who suffer from both insomnia and obstructive sleep apnea are more likely to suffer from heart problems and are almost 50% more likely to die than those without either condition, say researchers, who advise people being tested for one of the disorders be tested for the other.

entry.title: How to connect Azure SQL database from Python Function App using managed identity or access token
entry.summary:
This blog will demonstrate on how to connect Azure SQL database from Python Function App using managed identity or access token. If you are looking for how to implement it in Windows App Service, you may refer to this post: https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/apps-on-azure-blog/how-to-connect-azure-sql-database-from-azure-app-service-windows/ba-p/2873397. Note that Azure Active Directory managed identity authentication method was added in ODBC Driver since version 17.3.1.1 for both system-assigned and user-assigned identities. In Azure blessed image for Python Function, the ODBC Driver version is 17.8. Which makes it possible to leverage this feature in Linux App Service.
Briefly, this post will provide you a step to step guidance with sample code and introduction on the authentication…

entry.title: GitHub Actions: GitHub-hosted runners now run Node.js 16 by default
entry.summary: GitHub Actions: GitHub-hosted runners now run Node.js 16 by default

entry.title: Scientists identify malfunctioning brain cells as potential target for Alzheimer's treatment
entry.summary: Scientists have identified a rare population of potentially toxic senescent cells in human brains that can serve as a target for a new Alzheimer's disease treatment.

entry.title: Improvements to the code scanning API
entry.summary: Improvements to the code scanning API

entry.title: Melatonin exacerbates asthma, study finds
entry.summary: Asthma sufferers generally find their condition gets worse at night. Now researchers may understand why. Melatonin, a sleep hormone that is sometimes prescribed to treat insomnia, exasperates the constriction of the bronchus -- the pathway that moves air to and from your lungs, according to a new study.

entry.title: The Counterfactual Theory of Value
entry.summary: The Labor Theory of Value argues that the value of a product or a service is determined by the amount of labor required to produce it. If so, something that takes 100 hours to produce is worth 10x more than something that takes 10 hours. One issue with the Labor Theory is it often causes The post The Counterfactual Theory of Value appeared first on David Perell.

entry.title: GitHub Actions: Changes to permissions in workflows triggered by Dependabot
entry.summary: GitHub Actions: Changes to permissions in workflows triggered by Dependabot

entry.title: Lists are now available as a public beta
entry.summary: Lists level up the starring experience by making it easy to organize and curate your favorite repositories on GitHub. You can create public lists that appear on your stars page at https://github.com/USERNAME?tab=stars. Lists are available to

entry.title: A diet rich in plant-based products reduces the risk of cognitive impairment in the elderly
entry.summary: A diet rich in plant products reduces the risk of cognitive impairment and dementia in the elderly.

entry.title: A diet rich in plant-based products reduces the risk of cognitive impairment in the elderly
entry.summary: A diet rich in plant products reduces the risk of cognitive impairment and dementia in the elderly.

entry.title: Warning signs of sight loss could be identified before vision deteriorates
entry.summary: A new study has shown that the signs of age related macular degeneration can set in earlier than previously thought -- even before patients begin to lose their sight. The findings open the door for research into earlier treatment that could help slow down the onset of the condition the most common cause of sight loss in the western world.

entry.title: Sunshine may shield children, young adults from MS
entry.summary: Living in sunny locations and spending time outdoors may raise the risk for skin cancer, but a new study shows that in children and young adults, sun exposure may protect against multiple sclerosis. The study follows previous work by other researchers that has demonstrated an association between increased ultraviolet exposure in childhood and lower odds of adult MS.

entry.title: Does air pollution reduce the benefits of physical activity on the brain?
entry.summary: A new study shows that people who do vigorous physical activities, like jogging or playing competitive sports, in areas with higher air pollution may show less benefit from that exercise when it comes to certain markers of brain disease. The markers examined in the study included white matter hyperintensities, which indicate injury to the brain's white matter, and gray matter volume. Larger gray matter volumes and smaller white matter hyperintensity volumes are markers of overall better brain health.

entry.title: Does air pollution reduce the benefits of physical activity on the brain?
entry.summary: A new study shows that people who do vigorous physical activities, like jogging or playing competitive sports, in areas with higher air pollution may show less benefit from that exercise when it comes to certain markers of brain disease. The markers examined in the study included white matter hyperintensities, which indicate injury to the brain's white matter, and gray matter volume. Larger gray matter volumes and smaller white matter hyperintensity volumes are markers of overall better brain health.

entry.title: Secure communications end-to-end for Spring Boot apps – in Zero Trust environment
entry.summary:
Today, we are excited to announce the general availability of all the features to secure communications end-to-end for Spring Boot apps – in a Zero Trust environment. You can secure communications end-to-end or terminate transport-level security at any communication point for Spring Boot apps. You can also automate the provisioning and configuration for all the Azure resources needed for securing communications.
Implementing secure communications as part of your solution architecture can be challenging. Many customers manually rotate their certificates or create their own solutions to automate provisioning and configuration. Even then, there is still data exfiltration risk – say unauthorized copying or transfer of data from server systems. With Azure Spring Cloud, all of this is handled …

entry.title: Audit log streaming beta update – Google Cloud Storage support
entry.summary: GitHub Enterprise Cloud customers participating in the audit log streaming public beta may now use Google Cloud Storage when configuring a stream. This will allow tools that support Google Cloud Storage as a data source

entry.title: Imagining future guilt helps athletes turn away from doping
entry.summary: Appealing to athletes' sense of 'future guilt' through psychological intervention could prove a powerful weapon in the fight against doping, according to a new study.

entry.title: MRI’s may be initial window into CTE diagnosis in living; approach may shave years off diagnosis
entry.summary: While chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE) cannot yet be diagnosed during life, a new study provides the best evidence to date that a commonly used brain imaging technique, magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), may expedite the ability to diagnose CTE with confidence in the living.

entry.title: Trends in binge drinking among older men and women in the United States
entry.summary: Binge drinking has increased in recent years among older U.S. men but not among older women, according to a new study.

entry.title: GitHub Enterprise Server 3.3 is Generally Available
entry.summary: GitHub Enterprise Server 3.3 is Generally Available

entry.title: AI-powered computer model predicts disease progression during aging
entry.summary: Using artificial intelligence, a team of researchers has developed a novel system that models the progression of chronic diseases as patients age.

entry.title: SRC-2 is at the center of survival adaptations to food shortages
entry.summary: The steroid receptor coactivator-2 (SRC-2) is crucial to coordinate the biological responses to the lack of food.

entry.title: A daily dose of yogurt could be the go-to food to manage high blood pressure
entry.summary: Whether it's a dollop on your morning cereal or a simple snack on the go, a daily dose of yogurt could be the next go-to food for people with high blood pressure, according to new research.

entry.title: Primates vs cobras: How our last common ancestor built venom resistance
entry.summary: The last common ancestor of chimps, gorillas and humans developed an increased resistance toward cobra venom, according to new research.
